title: Ola Electric responds to ARAI notice, says prices of S1 X 2 kWh scooter unchanged
description: The Automotive Research Association of India (ARAI) had raised concerns about Ola Electric’s failure to inform the agency of a price reduction for its S1 X 2 kilowatt-hour model before initiating its high-profile “BOSS” sale.
content: Responding to a notice from the Automotive Research Association of India (ARAI) questioning the pricing strategies of its S1 X 2 kilowatt-hour (kWh) scooters, Ola Electric said in a stock exchange filing that the price of its scooters has not changed during its flagship BOSS sale event. Last week, ARAI sent a notice to the Bengaluru-based firm regarding its pricing strategies for the S1 X 2 kWh model ahead of its flagship sale launched last week. During the sale, the model's price dropped to Rs 49,999, with additional benefits of up to Rs 25,000 on the S1 series.In an exchange filing on Tuesday, Ola Electric stated that it is running a limited-time festive campaign offering a general discount of Rs 5,000 to all customers and a higher discount of Rs 25,000 to a select few.Ola Electric provided an invoice dated October 6, showing a Rs 5,000 discount given to customers, along with a screenshot from its app confirming the unchanged price of the scooter. It added that the Rs 25,000 discount applied only to a limited inventory.“We have responded to ARAI that we have not changed the price of Ola S1 X 2KWh; and we are running a very limited time festive campaign for a brief period where we are giving a general discount of Rs 5,000 to every customer and higher discount of Rs 25,000 to only a few customers and that too only with very limited inventories,” the Bengaluru-based company said in an exchange filing.
